senses.de: A place where goods are sold
senses.ex: I bought this dress at a store downtown.

Tips.title: Location Descriptor
Tips.description: Use 'store' to describe a specific place where items are purchased, not general buying activity.
Tips.example: Let's meet at the electronics store after lunch.

Tips.title: Physical Presence
Tips.description: 'Store' implies a physical space you can visit, though it can extend to online.
Tips.example: The rug store on Main Street also has an online store.

senses.de: A large amount of something that is kept for future use
senses.ex: I have a store of canned food in my cellar.

Tips.title: Future Use
Tips.description: 'Store' in this sense means keeping something to use it later, not immediately.
Tips.example: He has a store of batteries for emergencies.

senses.de: To keep or accumulate for future use
senses.ex: We store our garden furniture in the shed over winter.

Tips.title: Safekeeping
Tips.description: To 'store' is to intentionally keep something safe until you need it.
Tips.example: Store your valuables in a safe place while traveling.

senses.de: An area in a computer's memory used for storing information
senses.ex: The app takes up a lot of store on my phone.

Tips.title: Technical Term
Tips.description: In computing, 'store' is technical jargon. Understand its context before use.
Tips.example: This database serves as the central store for all our user data.

senses.ex: You can download the game from the app store.

Tips.title: Digital Marketplace
Tips.description: For online markets, 'store' can refer to a place you visit virtually to download digital goods.
Tips.example: I found a useful budgeting app in the app store.

Boutique.wordDefinition:
A boutique is a small store that sells unique, specialized, or high-end items such as designer clothes, jewelry, or cosmetics.

Typically, the items in a boutique are more expensive and exclusive than those in a regular store.

A boutique is a small store that specializes in upscale and unique merchandise, while a store can refer to any type of retail establishment that sells goods.

Emporium.wordDefinition:
Emporium and store are both places where you can buy things, but there are some differences between them.

An emporium is a large store that sells a variety of goods, often with a wide selection of high-quality or luxurious items.

Emporiums often have a fancy or upscale feel to them and are typically found in larger cities. They tend to sell more unique or expensive products and may have a specific theme, like a Christmas emporium or an antique emporium.

An emporium is a fancy, larger store with a specific theme and selection of high-quality or unique items.

Establishment.wordDefinition:
Establishment refers to any type of business or organization that has been established or founded, such as a company, restaurant, or school.

Establishment has a broader meaning than store and can refer to any type of business or organization, while store specifically refers to a business that sells goods.

Market.wordDefinition:
A market is a place where multiple vendors sell goods or services, often outdoors or in a large hall. It usually has an informal atmosphere with various stalls and vendors selling a wide range of products such as fresh produce, meats, clothes, and souvenirs.

A market is a bustling area where many vendors congregate to sell various goods, while a store is a commercial establishment that sells branded goods in a more formal manner.

Outlet.wordDefinition:
An outlet is a retail location that sells discounted or clearance merchandise, often from an older season or style.

Outlet stores are usually located away from city centers and in malls or shopping centers specifically designed for outlet shopping.

The merchandise sold at an outlet store may be overstock, out-of-season, or factory seconds. Outlet stores often carry a variety of brands under one roof.

These stores may offer sales or discounts, but not to the extent of an outlet store. They may also have a wider variety of products and name brands.

An outlet is a store that sells discounted or older merchandise, while a store sells new or current merchandise at regular prices.

Repository.wordDefinition:
A repository is a place or system where things are stored and kept organized for future use or reference. In the world of technology, it typically refers to a place where code or files can be stored and managed, such as a git repository on GitHub.

So, while both words refer to places where things are kept, a repository is typically used for organizing and managing data or information, while a store is used for buying and selling goods.

Shop.wordDefinition:
Both shop and store refer to a place where goods are sold, but their usage can vary depending on the context and location.

Shop typically refers to a smaller, more specialized retail establishment that sells specific goods/services (such as a coffee shop, gift shop, or repair shop).

Shop usually refers to a smaller and more specialized retail establishment, while store tends to refer to larger and more general establishments.

Storehouse.wordDefinition:
A storehouse is a large building used for storing goods in large quantities. These goods could be anything from food to industrial equipment.

Unlike a store, a storehouse is not open to the public and is used for storage purposes only.

A store is a place to buy things while a storehouse is a place to keep things.

Warehouse.wordDefinition:
A warehouse is a large building used for storing products, goods, and inventory on a large scale.

It is usually located near transportation hubs such as airports, railways, or harbors. Warehouses are used by manufacturers, wholesalers, and retailers to store and ship their goods in bulk.

Unlike stores, warehouses are not open to the public and are used mainly for business-to-business transactions.

quotes.Text: I was lucky because I used to live right next to a video-rental store. I used to spend so much time watching films. So I've seen a lot. I used to watch 'Dynasty' and 'Dallas' and have seen every kind of film. I've been influenced by everything I've seen.
quotes.Title: Lebanese Actress
quotes.Name: Nadine Labaki

quotes.Text: There's a deep-freeze of sorts for all good intentions - a place that you store your plans to make changes in your life when you know you're not going to make them at all.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Jeffrey Kluger

quotes.Text: You can live your life angry, bitter, mad at somebody or even guilty, not letting go of your own mistakes, but you won't receive the good things God has in store.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: From when we were about seven we worked in our family store during the holidays. My father said it was important that we know where our money came from.
quotes.Title: British Writer
quotes.Name: Lady Colin Campbell

quotes.Text: I grew up above a video store. My dad had an account with them and... he was very busy and had his own life. So I just would watch movies nonstop.
quotes.Title: Italian Actress
quotes.Name: Julia Fox

quotes.Text: Each Wal-Mart store should reflect the values of its customers and support the vision they hold for their community.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Sam Walton

quotes.Text: I think it's important that you know every detail when you open a store, that you pay attention to everything.
quotes.Title: French Businessman
quotes.Name: Francois Nars

quotes.Text: If something's a high-margin product, I understand its importance to the store.
quotes.Title: American Architect
quotes.Name: Peter Marino

quotes.Text: The thing about wisdom is you store the past in your head.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Herm Edwards

quotes.Text: I like to support local record stores.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Parker Posey
